m_szDocTitle: Global Clean Energy Investment Dropped In Q1'16 Due To Chinese Slowdown | CleanTechnica
m_szDocSumamry: April 20th, 2016 by Joshua S Hill   Global clean energy investment dropped in the first quarter of 2016 due to an investment slowdown in China, despite mega-financings in the UK and Norway. This is the primary conclusion from Bloomberg New Energy Finance’s (BNEF) data team, which found that global clean energy investment in the first quarter of 2016 had dropped 22% on the previous quarter, down to $53.1 billion from Q4’15’s $68.1 billion, and 12% below Q1’15’s $60.4 billion.
